job_details.Vacaturetitel: Life Science Software Engineer International Flavors & Fragrances
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
Our R&D team develops microbial production strains and engineer enzymes for applications in the areas of food & beverages, home & personal care, animal feed, paper & textile processing, and more. We implement all steps in the process, from business idea and the use of generative AI to sample genetic diversity, to assay design, high-throughput screening, full-scale testing and manufacture at our production plants.

   We are looking for an experienced engineer at the interfaces of software development, lab automation and biology. As part of our team, you will create software that automates everything that can be automated and ensures that generated data is structured and accessible.

   In our team, machine learning staff, molecular biologists, biochemists, and automation hardware engineers work side-by-side. Improvements are deployed with minimal delay, and you can expect to have large impact on the value of our products.

   As Life Science Software Engineer, you will help to create the stack that implements our domain logic, and how it communicates with storage backends as well as instruments, liquid handlers and fermenters. You have freedom to find preferred 3rd party technologies as well as deciding on the components that you prefer us to develop internally.

   The Leiden R&D team is highly skilled and operates with a start-up mentality and a sharp focus on continuous improvement., * Design data models to support experimental protocols and write software that automates the generation of robot instructions as well as analysis and visualization of biological sequence-, and screening-data.
     * Maintain workflows and be pro-active in adjusting and improving them as experimental techniques evolve.
     * Identify and onboard 3rd party services and tools to offload responsibilities and let us focus on differentiating activities.
     * Create software that allows us to seamlessly integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling) and ML Ops.
     * Document, communicate and teach colleagues best-practices.
job_details.full_text:
Life Science Software Engineer International Flavors & Fragrances

Our R&D team develops microbial production strains and engineer enzymes for applications in the areas of food & beverages, home & personal care, animal feed, paper & textile processing, and more. We implement all steps in the process, from business idea and the use of generative AI to sample genetic diversity, to assay design, high-throughput screening, full-scale testing and manufacture at our production plants.

   We are looking for an experienced engineer at the interfaces of software development, lab automation and biology. As part of our team, you will create software that automates everything that can be automated and ensures that generated data is structured and accessible.

   In our team, machine learning staff, molecular biologists, biochemists, and automation hardware engineers work side-by-side. Improvements are deployed with minimal delay, and you can expect to have large impact on the value of our products.

   As Life Science Software Engineer, you will help to create the stack that implements our domain logic, and how it communicates with storage backends as well as instruments, liquid handlers and fermenters. You have freedom to find preferred 3rd party technologies as well as deciding on the components that you prefer us to develop internally.

   The Leiden R&D team is highly skilled and operates with a start-up mentality and a sharp focus on continuous improvement., * Design data models to support experimental protocols and write software that automates the generation of robot instructions as well as analysis and visualization of biological sequence-, and screening-data.
     * Maintain workflows and be pro-active in adjusting and improving them as experimental techniques evolve.
     * Identify and onboard 3rd party services and tools to offload responsibilities and let us focus on differentiating activities.
     * Create software that allows us to seamlessly integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling) and ML Ops.
     * Document, communicate and teach colleagues best-practices.

profile_classification.rationale: The role emphasizes building software for automating biological experiments, data analysis, and integrating with lab equipment and ML Ops. While generative AI is mentioned, the core focus is on data engineering, modeling for biological data, and software development for lab automation, aligning more closely with an ML Engineer's responsibilities in a specialized domain.

phrases: from business idea
applications in the areas of food & beverages, home & personal care, animal feed, paper & textile processing, and more
large impact on the value of our products
job_tasks.justification: These phrases indicate an understanding of the business context, the application domains, and the impact of the work on product value.

phrases: ensures that generated data is structured and accessible
Design data models to support experimental protocols
write software that automates the generation of robot instructions as well as analysis and visualization of biological sequence-, and screening-data
seamlessly integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling)
job_tasks.justification: The description focuses on structuring, accessing, and processing data from experiments, including designing data models and automating data generation and analysis.

phrases: use of generative AI
machine learning staff
ML Ops
job_tasks.justification: Mentions the use of generative AI and the presence of machine learning staff, suggesting involvement in or interaction with modeling activities.

phrases: software development
create software that automates everything that can be automated
create the stack that implements our domain logic
how it communicates with storage backends as well as instruments, liquid handlers and fermenters
freedom to find preferred 3rd party technologies as well as deciding on the components that you prefer us to develop internally
write software that automates the generation of robot instructions
Create software that allows us to seamlessly integrate our Laboratory Information Management System (Benchling) and ML Ops
job_tasks.justification: The role explicitly requires creating software to automate processes, implement domain logic, integrate with hardware and systems, and develop internal components.

phrases: ML Ops
Improvements are deployed with minimal delay
job_tasks.justification: Direct mention of 'ML Ops' and the emphasis on rapid deployment of improvements indicate a focus on operational aspects of ML systems.

items: analysis and visualization of biological sequence-, and screening-data

Document, communicate and teach colleagues best-practices
soft_skills.justification: Highlights collaboration with diverse scientific roles and the need to communicate and teach best practices.

phrases: continuous improvement
experimental techniques evolve
start-up mentality
soft_skills.justification: Emphasizes continuous improvement, adapting to evolving techniques, and a start-up mentality, all indicative of a need for learning and adaptability.

phrases: automates everything that can be automated
offload responsibilities and let us focus on differentiating activities
freedom to find preferred 3rd party technologies as well as deciding on the components that you prefer us to develop internally
soft_skills.justification: The role involves automating processes, identifying efficient solutions (3rd party vs. internal development), and making pragmatic technology choices.

phrases: freedom to find preferred 3rd party technologies as well as deciding on the components that you prefer us to develop internally
pro-active in adjusting and improving them
start-up mentality
soft_skills.justification: Grants freedom in technology selection, encourages proactivity in improvements, and mentions a start-up mentality, all pointing towards innovation and ownership.
